p: Winged bean is a climbing twinning plant (climb up to 3â€“5 m). It has green trifoliate leaves made up from three leaflets of ovate to deltoid shape. It produces 2.5 to 3.5 cm wide flowers with colors ranging from purple, white and blue, blue to red. The pollen grains are spheroidal with a polar axis that measures between 42.3 and 51.6 cm and an equatorial axis that measure between 43.4 and 49.9 cm. Its roots are tuberous; a tuber ranges in size between 8 and 12 cm in length and 2 to 4 cm in width. It produces elongated pods (the fruit) with four corners ( Figure 1) and at each one the pod bears a wing, hence the name of winged bean. Each pod ranges from 15 to 30 cm in length, and it is about 3 cm in width [ 8].
